intro: Licania leptostachya var. axilliflora, commonly known as the axillary-flowered licania, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in axillary inflorescences, and typically have a pale pink to white color. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
